description: Latin ligātus, perfect passive participle of ligō (“I bind”). Doublet of legato. Compare league.

verbs.description: ligate (third-person singular simple present ligates, present participle ligating, simple past and past participle ligated)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To bind with a ligature or bandage.
(transitive, typography) To connect text characters with a ligature.
(transitive, intransitive, chemistry) To join by ligation.
